jhelp.util.io

Class ByteArray

  • java.lang.Object
    • jhelp.util.io.ByteArray

  • public class ByteArray
extends java.lang.Object
    Byte array can be use as ByteArray.InternalInputStream and OutputStream
    Author:
    JHelp

      • read

        public int read(byte[] b)
        Read some bytes and fill an array.
        Do same as read(b, 0, b.length)
        Parameters:
        b - Array to fill
        Returns:
        Number of read bytes

       int off,
       int len)

        Parameters:
        b - Array to fill
        off - Where start fill the array
        len - Number maximum of byte to read
        Returns:

      • readBinarizable

        public <B extends Binarizable> B readBinarizable(java.lang.Class<B> clas)
                                      throws java.lang.Exception
        Read a Binarizable from the byte array.
        See writeBinarizable(Binarizable) for write a Binarizable
        Type Parameters:
        B - Type of Binarizable
        Parameters:
        clas - Class of the Binarizable to read
        Returns:
        The read Binarizable
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - If the actual read data in the byte array doesn't represents the Binarizable asked

      • readBinarizableArray

        public <B extends Binarizable> B[] readBinarizableArray(java.lang.Class<B> clas)
                                             throws java.lang.Exception
        Read an array of Binarizable.
        See writeBinarizableArray(Binarizable...) for write an array of Binarizable
        Type Parameters:
        B - Type of Binarizable
        Parameters:
        clas - Class of the Binarizable to read
        Returns:
        The read array
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - If the byte array doesn't contains an array of desired Binarizable at the actual read index

      • writeBoolean

        public void writeBoolean(boolean booleanValue)
        Write a boolean.
        See readBoolean()
        Parameters:
        booleanValue - Boolean to write

      • writeBooleanArray

        public void writeBooleanArray(boolean... bools)
        Write a boolean array to the byte array.
        The number of bytes takes here is 4(Array length)+(NumberOfBoolean)/8, that mean if you have to store several boolen, its more efficient to use this method (Number of byte took for store data are less) if the number of boolean is at least 5.
        See readBooleanArray() for read it later
        Parameters:
        bools - Boolean array to store
